meanings.sent1: Yesterday, I teed up the golf ball.
meanings.sent2: She teed off on the first hole.
meanings.sent3: The golfer teed the ball so high it almost touched the sky!
meanings.sent4: His anger teed up like a volcano ready to erupt.
meanings.sent5: The excitement teed in his heart as he prepared to swing.

meanings.definition: to place a golf ball on a tee before hitting it
meanings.sent1: He carefully teed the ball for his shot.
meanings.sent2: The golfer teed up for a long drive.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel thought the golf tee was a tiny tree for climbing!
meanings.sent4: Her hopes teed up high as she aimed for a hole-in-one.
meanings.sent5: The anticipation teed in the air as the golfer took aim.

meanings.definition: to support or prop something up with a tee
meanings.sent1: She teed the sign up with a small stand.
meanings.sent2: The artist teed the canvas against the wall.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to play with the tee holding up the plant.
meanings.sent4: His confidence teed up when he saw the tee supporting his work.
meanings.sent5: The idea teed in his mind to use a tee as a makeshift stand.
